text: - - Asian American More emotional expression Culturally typical amount of emotional expression (less than European Americans) European American Less emotional expression Culturally typical amount of emotional expression (more than Asian Americans) They conclude that depression “may result in a failure to endorse and enact cultural norms of emotional expression...these findings suggest that the impact of depression on emotional responding varies depending on the dominant cultural model of healthy emotional functioning.”
